intro: Lappula redowskii subsp. patula, commonly known as the slender lappia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces cylindrical, ribbed seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and wastelands. Lappula redowskii subsp. patula is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
